author: Gregory Korte
description: Voters in Virginia, New Jersey, New York and California will soon offer the strongest and earliest clues about America’s political landscape heading into next year’s consequential midterm elections.
title: High Turnout Marks First Major Elections of Trump’s Second Term

author: Josh Wingrove
description: US President Donald Trump announced a cut to fentanyl-related tariffs on imports from China and the continued freeze of some of his reciprocal levies on Chinese goods, formalizing key elements of the sweeping trade deal struck with Chinese leader Xi Jinping.
title: Trump Formalizes Fentanyl, Reciprocal Tariff Cuts in Xi Deal

author: Catherine Lucey
description: US President Donald Trump said he met with representatives from Switzerland and announced additional trade talks, as the European nation seeks to reduce a tariff rate that ranks higher than any other developed nation.
title: Trump Says He Met Swiss Leaders, Orders Additional Trade Talks

author: Yang Yang, Eleanor Harrison-Dengate, K Oanh Ha, Naomi Ng
description: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast: On the heels of the APEC summit, how Asia’s biggest economies are navigating rising tensions between the US and China.
title: APEC Leaders Walk Trump-Xi Tightrope

author: Josh Xiao
description: China’s Commerce Ministry is on its biggest public hiring spree this decade, bolstering the unit overseeing rare-earth curbs even as it pauses sweeping measures in a trade truce with the US.
title: China’s Export Control Taskforce Adds Most Headcount Since 2022

author: Faith DiBiagio
description: Cornell University is considering raising roughly $1 billion through taxable bonds, the latest elite US college looking to secure financing as the Trump administration targets the institutions.
title: Cornell Eyes $1 Billion Bond Sale Amid Trump’s Higher Ed Squeeze

author: Angus Whitley
description: Australia broadened its social media ban for under-16s to include some second-tier platforms including Reddit, a little more than a month before the world-first legislation takes effect.
title: Australia Widens Under-16 Social Media Ban to Include Reddit

author: Gregory Korte
description: Contests will give parties a gauge of voter sentiment before midterms.
title: Trump’s Political Standing Put to Test in Off-Year Elections

author: Manuela Tobias, Maria Elena Vizcaino
description: Argentine President Javier Milei and his Economy Minister Luis Caputo will meet a select group of investors and company representatives in New York this week, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Argentina’s Milei, Caputo to Meet Investors in New York Friday

author: Brian Platt, Erik Hertzberg
description: Canada is set to rack up larger deficits under Mark Carney, who used his first budget as prime minister to inject tens of billions of dollars into defense, housing and major projects intended to help the country increase exports to overseas markets.
title: Canada Set to Add $119 Billion to Deficits as Growth Stalls

author: Melissa Shin
description: Canada’s government will proceed with measures announced last year to allow some businesses to speed up how quickly they write off machinery and equipment, as well as to expense research and development costs immediately to save on corporate taxes.
title: Canada Speeds Up Investment, Research Writeoffs for Businesses

author: Christine Dobby
description: Canada’s government is taking aim at competition in the financial sector, pledging to tackle fees, make it easier for consumers to switch banks and reduce regulatory burdens for smaller lenders.
title: Carney Government Targets Banking Competition in Budget

author: Natalia Drozdiak
description: Nine months into his second term, President Donald Trump has bombed Iran’s nuclear program, struck Houthi rebels in Yemen and killed dozens of alleged narco-terrorists in Venezuela. Over the weekend, he threatened to send US troops “guns-a-blazing” to Nigeria to stop the killing of Christians.
title: Trump's Military Use in Other Countries Tests His MAGA Base

author: Isabel Gottlieb
description: The future of much of President Donald Trump’s tariff campaign rests in the hands of the US Supreme Court, which will decide whether he can use an emergency law that had previously never been wielded to impose import taxes.
title: Here Are Trump’s Options If the Supreme Court Says His Tariffs Are Illegal

author: Anthony Capaccio, Roxana Tiron
description: The Pentagon is gearing up to invest in defense companies and offer grants, loans and other incentives as way of speeding up weapons development and attracting more competitive bids for contracts, according to a draft memo.
title: Pentagon Pushes Ahead With Plan to Overhaul Weapons Buying

author: Galit Altstein
description: Israel’s ruling coalition wants next year’s budget to take the country “from conflict to growth” and estimates the deficit will shrink now that a ceasefire with Hamas has been secured, Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said.
title: Israel Looks to Rein In Deficit After Two Years of Costly War

author: Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump further muddied the fate of the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program with a social media post Tuesday suggesting he would not provide benefits until after the government reopened.
title: Trump Says US Won’t Send Food Aid While Government Shut Down

author: Zoe Tillman
description: Nonprofits and cities are asking a judge to compel the Trump administration to fully cover food aid benefits for low income households this month, after US officials announced they would make only 50% of the funds available.
title: Trump Officials Accused of Disobeying Court in Food Aid Fight

author: John Ainger
description: The COP30 host is aiming to raise $10 billion initially, down from an earlier target of $25 billion, for a new vehicle that will help countries protect their forests.
title: Brazil Lowers Near-Term Target for $125 Billion Rainforest Fund

author: Patrick Van Oosterom
description: Rob Jetten, whose center-left Democrats 66 party won last week’s Dutch election, tapped Wouter Koolmees to begin preliminary talks to create a government coalition.
title: Dutch Parties to Begin Coalition Talks After Negotiator Pick

author: Simon Marks
description: Sudan’s army is considering a US proposal for a three-month ceasefire to end hostilities that have sparked global alarm over allegations of mass atrocities.
title: Sudan Army Weighs US Truce Plan as UN Pleads for End to Violence

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: The US military is close to fielding two new weapons designed to temporally jam Chinese and Russian intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance satellites, giving the Pentagon three counter-space capabilities, according to new Space Force data.
title: US Space Force to Use Three Weapons To Jam Chinese Satellites Via Remote Control

author: Emele Onu, Henrique Almeida
description: Nigeria is planning to sell $2.3 billion in eurobonds as soon as this week, testing investor appetite for the debt days after US President Donald Trump threatened military action against Islamist militants in the country and sparked a selloff.
title: Nigeria Shrugs Off Trump Threat to Proceed With Eurobond Plan

author: Daniel Flatley, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent suggested that the US eventually could allow high-end computer chips made by Nvidia Corp. to be sold to Chinese companies as he teased additional meetings between President Donald Trump and the Chinese leader Xi Jinping next year.
title: Bessent Suggests High-End Nvidia Chips Could Go to China One Day

author: Myles Miller
description: New Jersey authorities responded to bomb threats at polling stations in seven counties, prompting temporary closures as voting began, according to state Attorney General Matthew Platkin.
title: NJ Officials Respond to Bomb Threats as Voting Begins

author: Julian Lee
description: The amount of Russian oil held on tankers has risen by 8% since the start of September
title: Russia's Crude Deliveries Plunge as US Sanctions Begin to Bite

author: Erik Hertzberg
description: Canada is set to launch a C$50 billion ($35.5 billion) infrastructure fund to build projects in sectors such as hospitals, transportation and housing, as the government tries to boost an economy that’s being squeezed by US tariffs.
title: Canada to Start $36 Billion Building Fund as Carney Seeks Economic Growth

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: The ongoing US government shutdown is now tied for the longest in history as the resolution of Tuesday’s high-profile elections in New York City and elsewhere stand to alter the political dynamics in Washington, and potentially remove one obstacle to ending the standoff.
title: Shutdown Ties Record as Elections Create Possible Turning Point

author: Milda Seputyte, Laura Alviz
description: Rheinmetall AG moved ahead with plans for a Lithuanian ammunition plant, marking the biggest defense investment in the country’s history and boosting production capacity on NATO’s eastern flank.
title: Rheinmetall Advances East Europe Expansion With Lithuania Plant

author: Pathom Sangwongwanich
description: In Thailand, the road to luring back Chinese tourists now runs through a moral pledge: keep gambling illegal and win Beijing’s favor.
title: Thailand Sees Return of Chinese Tourists After No-Casinos Pledge

author: Isobel Finkel
description: Support for Farage’s Reform UK surges in poorest neighborhoods.
title: British Politics Is Fracturing in Populist Era

author: Alister Bull
description: The Group of 20’s first report on inequality called for the creation of a panel to help governments confront a deepening crisis that is undermining democracy.
title: Stiglitz Declares an ‘Inequality Emergency’ in G-20 Report

author: Jenny Che
description: Shein, the e-commerce giant in the middle of a storm in France after a report it was selling childlike sex dolls on its platform, said it will fully cooperate with French authorities.
title: Shein to Work with French Authorities After Banning Sex Dolls

author: Sarah Jacob
description: China criticized the Dutch government for not taking enough steps to resolve a dispute over chipmaker Nexperia, which has spiraled into a supply crunch for the auto industry.
title: China Slams Dutch for Hard Line in Standoff Over Nexperia Chips

author: Georgia Hall
description: Polls showed Zohran Mamdani with a double-digit advantage over Andrew Cuomo heading into election day.
title: New York, the Capital of Capitalism, Prepares for a Socialist Mayor

author: Alicia Diaz, Skylar Woodhouse
description: The first major elections since Donald Trump’s victory last November are poised to deliver signals to both parties ahead of next year’s midterms.
title: What to Know About Elections in NY, NJ, Virginia and California

author: Greg Stohr
description: President Donald Trump’s three US Supreme Court appointees will play pivotal roles as the court considers the fate of his signature global tariffs Wednesday.
title: Trump Tariffs’ Fate Rides on Supreme Court Justices He Picked

author: Ruth Olurounbi, Arne Delfs
description: Nigerian Foreign Minister Yusuf Tuggar underscored his government’s commitment to religious freedom and the rule of law, pushing back against Donald Trump’s claim about the alleged killing of Christians in the western African nation.
title: Nigeria Pushes Back Against Trump’s Killing Christians Assertion

author: Salma El Wardany, Alex Longley
description: Russian oil will continue finding its way to the market despite tougher US sanctions, one of the world’s top oil traders said.
title: Russian Oil Will Find Buyers Despite Sanctions, Gunvor CEO Says

author: Daniel Basteiro, Jorge Valero, Alberto Nardelli, Arne Delfs
description: European leaders including German Chancellor Friedrich Merz and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen will skip the EU’s summit with Latin American and Caribbean states due in part to concerns over angering US President Donald Trump.
title: EU Leaders Skip Latin American Summit to Avoid Annoying Trump

author: Selcan Hacaoglu
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s top political ally chastised the US ambassador to the country for predicting a rapprochement between Turkey and Israel.
title: Key Ally of Turkey’s Erdogan Chides US Ambassador Over Israel

author: Joe Mayes
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves laid the ground for more tax hikes in a speech on Tuesday morning, in which she blamed the previous Conservative administration and global trade frictions for harming the UK economy.
title: Reeves Sets Stage for UK Tax Hikes, Pledges to Cut Debt Costs

author: Alice Gledhill
description: The pound fell to an almost seven month low and government bonds briefly jumped as Chancellor Rachel Reeves discussed the UK’s financial challenges ahead of her budget due later this month.
title: Pound Drops, Gilts Gain as Chancellor Speaks Ahead of UK Budget

author: Rthvika Suvarna
description: Singapore will cane scammers under a new law as the city-state grapples with crimes affecting thousands of people.
title: Singapore to Cane Scammers as Billions Lost in Fraud Surge

author: Okech Francis
description: South Sudan’s president appointed a new finance minister, the eighth time he’s replaced the head of the oil-producing nation’s Treasury in the past five years.
title: South Sudan Names Eighth Finance Minister in Five Years

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said Tuesday that US forces stationed in South Korea remain primarily focused on deterring North Korea but acknowledged Washington retains “flexibility for regional contingencies,” signaling potential roles beyond the Korean Peninsula amid rising tensions with China.
title: Hegseth Says US Forces in South Korea Have Regional Flexibility

author: Erica Yokoyama, Takashi Umekawa
description: Japanese Finance Minister Satsuki Katayama issued another set of verbal warnings on currency movements, reiterating a strong sense of urgency, as the markets grow more alert to the risk of government intervention down the line.
title: Japan’s Katayama Warns on FX After Yen Hits Fresh 8-Month Low

author: Zosia Wanat, Agnieszka Barteczko
description: Poland plans to start building a national anti-drone system within months, without waiting for the European Union’s “drone wall” initiative, the country’s deputy defense minister said.
title: Poland Wants Its Own Drone Wall To Counter Russian Threat

author: Tom Rees, William Standring
description: Economic insecurity is hastening the death of the two-party system that’s dominated UK politics for a century, detailed polling and deprivation data suggest.
title: UK’s Poorest Areas Turn En Masse Toward Nigel Farage’s Reform

author: Zoltan Simon, Andras Gergely, Marton Kasnyik
description: The party aiming to oust Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban at next year’s election plans to roll back lavish tax breaks for foreign companies as part of an economic overhaul.
title: Viktor Orban’s Rivals Want to Roll Back Tax Breaks for Carmakers

author: Kirsi Heikel
description: Finns’ faith in NATO’s security guarantees recovered since last spring after the US reaffirmed its commitment to the defense alliance.
title: Finns Turn More Positive on NATO Security Guarantees, Poll Shows

author: Akemi Terukina, Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi said she will put together the nation’s new growth strategy by next summer, while pledging to boost tax revenues without increasing taxation rates.
title: Japan’s Takaichi Aims for Growth Plan Compilation by Next Summer

author: Anisah Shukry
description: Malaysia said its sovereignty remains protected and it isn’t bound by sanctions imposed by US, as Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim faces criticism for a trade deal with the superpower.
title: Malaysia Defends US Trade Deal as Concerns Grow Over Sovereignty

author: Heesu Lee
description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung placed artificial intelligence at the heart of his administration’s economic vision, pledging to transform the country’s industries, public services and defense through aggressive AI investment and policy support.
title: South Korea’s Lee Puts AI Centre Stage in First Budget Speech

author: Jim Wyss, Eric Martin
description: A key meeting for leaders from across the Americas has been shelved until next year, as US military strikes on boats in the Caribbean and near South America’s Pacific coast intensify tensions with Venezuela and divide the region.
title: Americas Summit Shelved After Deadly US Boat Strikes Jolt Region

author: Philip Glamann
description: China called on the US to avoid four sensitive issues so a trade truce sealed between Presidents Donald Trump and Xi Jinping can hold, highlighting the broad array of disagreements that will test ties.
title: China Urges US to Avoid ‘Red Lines’ After Reaching Trade Truce

author: Justin Sink
description: A majority of the corporate donors who have been named as donors to President Donald Trump’s ballroom construction project have received government contracts in recent years, according to a report released Monday by a watchdog group.
title: Most Trump Ballroom Donors Have Federal Contracts, Watchdog Says

author: Jimmy Jenkins
description: The US Justice Department rebutted allegations by New York Attorney General Letitia James and former FBI Director James Comey that the prosecutor hand-picked by the president to pursue criminal cases against them was unlawfully appointed and must be removed.
title: DOJ Rebuts Comey, James Push to Remove Virginia Prosecutor

author: Miranda Davis, Michael Hirtzer, Romaine Bostick
description: The UK is still in talks with President Donald Trump’s administration for a deal to address US tariffs on steel and whiskey, according to the British Consul General in Chicago.
title: UK Still in Talks With Trump Team Over Steel, Whiskey Tariffs

author: Philip Aldrick
description: The budget hole UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves has to fill will be smaller than widely feared because unexpectedly strong pay growth has offset an anticipated productivity downgrade, according to the Resolution Foundation.
title: Reeves Faces Smaller-Than-Expected Fiscal Hole, Think Tank Says
